title.narrative: Developing Technology Sector Competence and Entrepreneurship in Rwanda

description.narrative: This project application for Developing Technology Sector Competence and Entrepreneurship in Rwanda (three phases) will produce a study on all the information needed for the Rwanda?s Kigali region energy sector training programme. The work will be implemen ted by partners TAKK and Polar Partners Ltd Fortum as their advisor - and by experts on Africa and vocational technical training. The project will include two trips to Rwanda first of which will focus on collecting together all information for the prestudy . In the prestudy phase there will meetings with stakeholders - supported by Team Finland actors meetings with the Rwandan Ministry of Education representatives with potential education organisation partners and with Fortum representatives in Kigali.In th e second phase one will recognize and negotiate with local education organisations on who will be the partner for the whole project. The project partners will find out with the potential education partners what is the competence for the energy sector in th e Kigali region. The project will identify trainer potential likely target groups for recruitment training programme (skilled workers in electricity installation welding machinery automation) and workplace instructors. In addition one will study the prereq uisites of the actual training programme that is the professional competence requirements for technical sector vocational qualifications and certified short courses.In the third project phase in fall 2019 in Rwanda a contract will confirm the local educati on partnership in Kigali. Also in the fall the actual project study will be produced on setting up an energy sector training programme in Kigali Rwanda. The contract will consider all phases of acquiring the competence and on learning in the workplace sta rting from student acquisitions until the recruitment; including trainers? training workplace instruction and assessment of competence. With the end result one can choose to continue to the phases of making the business plan considering the impact on socie ty training the development country actor and providing vocational training support for the education organisation partner.
